p: This plant family is distributed worldwide in a wide range of habitats. The group includes herbs, shrubs, and trees, usually with small greenish flowers, with some species bearing stinging hairs. They are grouped into around 43 genera and 1700 species. Members of this family are commonly used as a source of fiber for clothing ( Boehmeria spp.), gardening ( Pilea spp.), and food ( Urtica spp.).
